title: Disambiguate First Parse Later: Generating Interpretations for Ambiguity Resolution in Semantic Parsing
author: Irina Saparina (University of Edinburgh), Mirella Lapata (University of Edinburgh)
relevance_why: The paper's approach to ambiguity resolution in semantic parsing can inform methods for audio-language integration by providing insights into handling ambiguities in multimodal contexts.
background: The paper addresses the challenge of resolving ambiguous natural language queries before converting them into formal expressions, specifically focusing on text-to-SQL tasks.
contribution: This paper introduces a modular approach to semantic parsing that resolves ambiguities by generating natural language interpretations before mapping them to SQL queries, achieving improved coverage of interpretations.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often directly map ambiguous queries to SQL, leading to biases towards preferred interpretations.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work separates the disambiguation and parsing tasks, using initial interpretations from language models and an additional infilling model to cover missing meanings.

key_innovation: The unique approach of generating all possible meanings in natural language before converting them to SQL queries allows for greater interpretation coverage and transparency.
real_world_impact: The proposed method could enhance the reliability of conversational AI systems, facilitating better user interactions with databases through more accurate query interpretations.
limitations: Dependency on reference interpretations for training the infilling model might limit scalability to new domains without sufficient annotated data.

new_terms.semantic parsing: **Semantic parsing** refers to the process of converting natural language into a formal representation that can be understood by a machine, such as SQL queries.
new_terms.infilling model: **Infilling model** is a specialized framework designed to identify and generate missing interpretations from an ambiguous query, enhancing the overall understanding of the user's request.
